channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India

item.title: ‘He refused to act on Jan 6’: Nancy Pelosi questions Donald Trump’s Los Angeles troop deployment; slams hypocrisy in National Guard use
item.description: Nancy Pelosi has strongly criticized Donald Trump's decision to deploy National Guard troops to Los Angeles without California's approval, contrasting it with his refusal to do so during the January 6 Capitol riot.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Will be met with very big force’: Donald Trump’s stern warning to protesters in Washington; security tightened in DC ahead of US Army’s 250th parade
item.description: President Trump warned potential protesters at the upcoming Washington military parade, coinciding with the US Army's 250th anniversary and his birthday, that they would face significant force. Amidst planned nationwide protests organized by groups like No Kings, Trump defended deploying troops to Los Angeles due to immigration raid protests.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: After LA, Chicago erupts in protest over immigration raids; over 1,000 protesters join downtown march - watch video
item.description: Chicago joined a nationwide wave of protests against Trump administration's immigration raids, as over 1,000 demonstrators rallied in the Loop. Protesters marched through downtown, disrupting traffic and demanding an end to deportations. Similar demonstrations are occurring in cities like New York and San Francisco, reflecting growing national anger over immigration enforcement and military involvement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Protests greet Muhammad Yunus in London; lawyers prepare to refer him to ICC
item.description: Muhammad Yunus, Bangladesh's chief advisor, faced protests in London by British Bangladeshis affiliated with the Awami League. Demonstrators accused his administration of human rights abuses and deteriorating law and order, demanding his resignation. An Awami League politician highlighted the plight of displaced members and alleged false cases.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: 'Got to do a better job': Donald Trump claims he dialled Gavin Newsom over LA unrest; governor says 'didn't even get a voicemail'
item.description: President Trump and Governor Newsom are in conflict, with Trump claiming he criticized Newsom's handling of California, a claim Newsom denies. This dispute arises as Newsom seeks to block National Guard involvement in immigration raids in Los Angeles, fearing escalated tensions. Trump, however, vows to "liberate" Los Angeles, portraying it as crime-ridden, despite its affluent reality.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mexico President refutes US claim that she incited LA protests: Calls it ‘absolutely false’
item.description: Claudia Sheinbaum refuted Kristi Noem's claim. Noem stated Sheinbaum encouraged Los Angeles protests against immigration raids. Sheinbaum denied the allegation. She affirmed Mexico's support for its diaspora in the United States. Sheinbaum emphasized her administration's commitment to peaceful actions. She urged Mexicans in the US to act peacefully. She condemned violent demonstrations. She stressed Mexico's defense of hardworking Mexicans.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Colombia rocked by bombings, shootings in southwest: 7 killed, 28 injured; fears rise of return to 90s-style guerrilla violence
item.description: A series of 24 coordinated bombings and gun attacks in southwestern Colombia have resulted in at least seven deaths and 28 injuries. Authorities suspect dissident FARC guerrillas, specifically the Central General Staff (EMC), are responsible for the attacks targeting police posts and civilian areas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Expats can now apply for Dubai government jobs offering salaries up to Dh40,000
item.description: Dubai's government is actively recruiting skilled expatriates for high-impact roles across various sectors, signaling a strategic focus on global expertise. These positions, listed, offer attractive salaries, some reaching Dh40,000 monthly. The initiative aims to bolster Dubai's ambitions in areas like urban planning, healthcare, and digital infrastructure by attracting experienced professionals worldwide.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: California Guv slams Trump over 'disrespect' to troops: Photos show National Guard sleeping on floors
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom has accused President Trump of disrespecting National Guard troops deployed to Los Angeles amid immigration protests, citing inadequate conditions and a politically motivated deployment. Newsom filed a lawsuit, alleging Trump exceeded his authority, while Trump suggested Newsom should be arrested for defiance. The Pentagon defended the operation, hinting at future militarized homeland approaches.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: European Union removes UAE from money laundering high-risk list
item.description: European Union has removed United Arab Emirates and seven other nations from its list of high-risk countries for money laundering. This decision acknowledges UAE's efforts to combat financial crimes. Monaco and nine other jurisdictions are now under increased scrutiny. The EU's action aligns with the Financial Action Task Force assessments.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘I would certainly invoke it’: Trump signals readiness to use Insurrection Act as LA immigration protests escalate
item.description: President Trump is considering invoking the Insurrection Act amidst ongoing protests in Los Angeles against his administration's immigration policies. He cited concerns about escalating violence and potential insurrection, despite objections from California's Governor Newsom. The Insurrection Act, a rarely used 1807 law, allows the president to deploy military forces to suppress civil disorder, potentially leading to a constitutional standoff.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's deployment of Marines & National Guard to LA's immigration protests: All you need to know
item.description: President Trump deployed 700 Marines and authorized 2,000 National Guard troops to Los Angeles amid immigration protests, sparking legal challenges from California officials who accuse him of overreach. Governor Newsom condemned the move as an abuse of power, while protests spread to other cities following immigration raids and arrests.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ex-Google MD recalls giving Sundar Pichai unsolicited advice on Chromebooks: ‘He knew way more than I did’
item.description: Parminder Singh, ex-Google and Twitter executive, recounted an amusing incident on X involving Sundar Pichai long before he became Google's CEO. Singh shared how he offered unsolicited advice on Chrome notebooks to an unassuming individual at a Google party, who turned out to be Pichai himself. Singh realized Pichai's extensive knowledge and gracious listening skills.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What triggered sanctions on Israel’s far-right ministers by UK, Canada & others — and what it means for Netanyahu’s government
item.description: In a coordinated move, Britain, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and Norway sanctioned Israeli ministers Itamar Ben-Gvir and Bezalel Smotrich for inciting violence and human rights abuses in the West Bank. The sanctions, including travel bans and asset freezes, reflect growing international concern over Israeli settlement expansion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump’s birthday and US Army’s 250th parade in DC: Full schedule, what to expect, where to stand & what’s restricted
item.description: Washington, D.C., is gearing up for a grand military parade on June 14th to celebrate the US Army's 250th anniversary, coinciding with Donald Trump's birthday. The event, featuring military vehicles, historical uniforms, and an airshow, is expected to draw 200,000 attendees.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Troops and turmoil in LA: Masked looters raid Apple store amidst immigration protests - viral video
item.description: Los Angeles is facing unrest as protests intensify against President Trump's immigration raids, leading to looting, including an Apple store incident. Trump has deployed National Guard troops and is escalating military presence, a move opposed by local officials and Governor Newsom. The protests were triggered by increased federal immigration enforcement, resulting in arrests and escalating tensions between the federal government and California leadership.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: iOS 26: When can UAE iPhone users expect Apple's latest update? See full features & specs
item.description: Apple's iOS 26 update arrives this fall for UAE iPhone 11 and later models, promising a "gorgeous new design" and "Apple Intelligence" features like live translation. A public beta is expected next month, likely around mid-July 2025, allowing users a sneak peek. Advanced AI features are exclusive to iPhone 15 Pro, iPhone 16 models, and M1-equipped iPads/Macs. Older devices like iPhone XR/XS will miss out on iOS 26 but will still receive security updates for iOS 18.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘We were well aware of risks’: Greta Thunberg on Gaza aid mission after being deported, calls Israeli action a ‘kidnapping’
item.description: Greta Thunberg, recently deported from Israel after being detained on a Gaza-bound aid boat, condemned Israel's actions as a "kidnapping" and a violation of rights. Upon arrival in Paris, she highlighted the dire conditions in Palestine, particularly Gaza, urging supporters to take action.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: String of explosions: Three killed after 16 bombs detonate in Colombia; coordinated attack suspected
item.description: Southwest Colombia experienced a series of coordinated attacks on Tuesday, resulting in three fatalities. Four car bombs and three additional explosive devices detonated across Cali, Corinto, El Bordo, and Jamundi. The explosions targeted police stations and municipal buildings, causing significant damage, including gutted buildings and wrecked storefronts. No group has claimed responsibility, but guerrillas are known to operate in the region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Dubai airports slashes parking fees for summer: Check, rates, timings & details here!
item.description: Dubai Airports has announced reduced long-term parking fees at all terminals from June 10-30, aiming to ease congestion and costs for outbound passengers during the peak summer travel season. With DXB anticipating 250,000 daily passengers, the offer provides significant savings, encouraging use of designated parking over curbside drop-offs. Visitors picking up guests can also benefit from these reduced rates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
